intro: Jussiaea angustifolia var. linearis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshes or along the edges of water bodies. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying aquatic plant communities.
